snippet: More than 57,000 patients have been waiting more than three months for medical appointments at V.A. facilities, and nearly 64,000 others have been in the system for a decade but have still not been seen by doctors.
abstract: Audit of the 731 facilities run by the Veterans Affairs Dept concludes that in 76 percent of the department's hospitals and clinics, there has been at least one instance of manipulated data on patient wait times, in many cases to hide delays in providing care; underscores extreme pressures on staff members at some facilities to falsify data and highlights the lack of doctors and nurse practitioners to deal with sharply rising demand for medical services at many of the department's hospitals and clinics.
lead_paragraph: More than 57,000 patients have been waiting more than three months for medical appointments at V.A. facilities, and nearly 64,000 others have been in the system for a decade but have still not been seen by doctors.

headline.main: Audit Shows Extensive Medical Delays for Tens of Thousands of Veterans
headline.print_headline: Audit Shows Extensive Medical Delays for Tens of Thousands of Veterans
